citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a complete perimeter fence surrounding the outdoor housing areas. The front section of a
primary enclosures that is currently housing 7 servals is not surrounded by a complete perimeter fence. Having a
perimeter fence in place protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going
through it or under it, permitting contact with the animals in the facility by unauthorized animals or patrons visiting the
facility. Additionally, it serves as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. The perimeter fence must
be sufficient distance from the outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact between animals inside the
enclosure and animals or persons outside the perimeter fence. Non-dangerous animals housed in outdoor facilities
require a 6-foot-tall perimeter fence around their enclosure and must be at least 3-feet away from any enclosures or
buildings, unless an approved variance has been issued in writing by the Administrator.
Correct by November 14, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The facility does not have a complete perimeter fence surrounding the outdoor housing areas. The front section of a 
primary enclosures that is currently housing 7 servals is not surrounded by a complete perimeter fence. Having a 
perimeter fence in place protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going 
through it or under it, permitting contact with the animals in the facility by unauthorized animals or patrons visiting the 
facility. Additionally, it serves as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. The perimeter fence must 
be sufficient distance from the outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact between animals inside the 
enclosure and animals or persons outside the perimeter fence. Non-dangerous animals housed in outdoor facilities 
require a 6-foot-tall perimeter fence around their enclosure and must be at least 3-feet away from any enclosures or 
buildings, unless an approved variance has been issued in writing by the Administrator. 
Correct by November 14, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
